Detailed Description

The Customizable Theme allows the user to set many properties for drawing controls.

const ControlFrameView * CustomizableTheme::GetControlFrameView (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns a pointer to a control frame view, which is used to draw the frame of a control including the background of the client area.

Implements Theme.

const Theme & CustomizableTheme::GetInstance (  CTResourcePack *  pack = 0  )  [static]
 

Returns:
an instance of the CustomizableTheme. Optionally, you can specify a resource pack that is set for the theme. This is just for your convenience, saving one method call. The same result as doing CTResourcePack* pack = (CTResourcePack*)ResourceManager::GetInstance().Construct(uri); CustomizableTheme& theme = (CustomizableTheme&)CustomizableTheme::GetInstance(pack); can be achieved with CTResourcePack* pack = (CTResourcePack*)ResourceManager::GetInstance().Construct(uri); CustomizableTheme& theme = (CustomizableTheme&)CustomizableTheme::GetInstance(); theme.SetResourcePack(pack); As long as the system is not initialized (System::IsInitialized returns false), a resource pack with default values is returned. This prevents errors when the system is starting up, as theme properties are requested even then.

const WCHAR * CustomizableTheme::GetName (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the name of the theme. Per default 0 is returned.

Reimplemented from Theme.

const PanelView * CustomizableTheme::GetPanelView (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns a pointer to a panel view, which is used to draw an instance of the class Panel. The panel usually is aligned at the bottom of the desktop and shows the softkeys.

Reimplemented from Theme.

const PositionIndicatorView * CustomizableTheme::GetPositionIndicatorView (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns a pointer to a position indicator view, which is used to draw an instance of the class PositionIndicator.

Implements Theme.

const ProgressBarView * CustomizableTheme::GetProgressBarView (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns a pointer to a progress bar view, which is used to draw an instance of the class ProgressBar.

Implements Theme.

const PushButtonView * CustomizableTheme::GetPushButtonView (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns a pointer to a push-button view, which is used to draw an instance of the class PushButton.

Implements Theme.

CTResourcePack* CustomizableTheme::GetResourcePack (   )  [inline]
 

Returns:
a pointer to the current resource pack

CTResourcePack * CustomizableTheme::GetResourcePackIfActive (   )  [static]
 

If the currently active theme is a customizable theme, return its resource pack, 0 otherwise

Returns:
the resource pack

const ColorTable * CustomizableTheme::GetSystemColorTable (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns a pointer to the color-table of the system-colors. This method should be overwritten by derived themes providing a pointer to a custom color-table. To stay backward-compatible with older versions of APOXI, 0 is returned in the default-implementation.

Reimplemented from Theme.

const WindowFrameView * CustomizableTheme::GetWindowFrameView (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns a pointer to a window frame view, which is used to draw the frame of a window including the background of the client area.

Implements Theme.

void CustomizableTheme::SetResourcePack (  CTResourcePack *  resource_pack  )  [inline]
 

Sets the resource pack.

void CustomizableTheme::Update (   )  [virtual]
 

Converts all colors given by the system-color-table to system-colors and invokes View::Update(this) for every View which is part of the theme. Also the fonts are updated which may be specified by ThemeConfig::GetFontId().

Reimplemented from Theme.
